title: wip** Calmdownman Multiplex
blurb: With online content creators generating contents across diverse platforms--youtube, twitch, instagram and such, I designed and developed an experimental website that culminates the dispersed contents into a single webpage.

title: SpaceTalk
blurb: A location based social media concept that builds on the current Naver map resources. This concept stems from the Gen Z users' need for 'fresh' information and the limitations in addressing this need through user reviews.

title: Naver Shopping Live - Redesign
blurb: UI features to better address user needs based on the three identified usage patterns--communicating, searching and exploring.

title: Naver Match
blurb: A service concept for integrating tennis(just an example among other sports) court reservation and match recruitment.

title: Naver Map - Redesign
blurb: Identified common user propensity to engage with other applications during their trips and proposed notification interactions for when the map application is in the background state.
kw: Mobile UI, Smart Watch UI, Redesign

title: Conversations for Curiosity
blurb:
This thesis explores the opportunities that social curiosity holds in supporting user discovery with conversational interfaces. Interactive components of curiosity inducing conversations and design considerations in transitioning such human experiences into agent interactions are identified through design workshops. 

From these findings, an initial version of the design guideline for generating curiosity inducing conversational agents is developed. The guideline is revised through designer interviews, where design implications of designing for user curiosity in conversational interfaces are further extracted.

This thesis contributes by proposing a new perspective to designing conversational interactions centered around the notion of arousing user curiosity. This is in stark contrast to the trends of supporting user discovery in conversational interfaces that had qualified their focus to the transactional qualities of conversations.

title: KCTC
blurb:
Completing my miltary service as a data analyst soldier at the Korea Combat Training Center in early 2021, I've had the most random opportunity to engage first hand with trending data analytic tools and military training data. During this experience, I felt that my innate interest in users(in this case, combatants) engraved through 7 years of UX background differentiated me from my fellow data analysts. I was able to guide the discussions on what sort of stories we wanted to tell. 

Examined combat capabilities, conjured up combat requirements and proposed new data collection requirements based on combat training data collected from the MILES training program(basically a 1000 vs 1000 laser tag) as a member of the data analysis team  at the Korea Combat Training Center.
kw: Data Analysis, Data Visualization, Spatio-temporal Data

title: Webpage "Archive"
blurb:
Deployed a website in anticipation of (to be more frank, in fear of) starting my military service somewhere deep in the mountainous frontier. I wanted to be able to manage it with minimal digital resource(ie; google spreadsheet CMS) and curate my off-duty acitivites--design works, shower thoughts and such. 

Little did I now that google was blocked at the military base.

title: Webpage "Reading List"
blurb: Another one of my military-anticipation-website. Reading list... thought it'd be cute to stack the books I've read.

title: indepth
blurb: A media display utilizing iron nails as pixels and servo motors for vertical motion that was inspired by the interplay of depth and clarity found in a frosted glass plate.

title: xhaust
blurb: An add-on filter that doubles as an inflatable 'thing' designed to tackle emission issues of engine idling found in construction site vehicles and food-trucks. Selected and exhibited at Dubai Global Grad Show 2018.

title: tilt
blurb: A shoe-care product(slash)furniture designed to befit the unique entrance space of a Korean one-person apartment. Exhibited at Seoul Design Week 2017.

title: move-N-pong
blurb: A motion sensing game application using device sensors--step counters and gyroscope sensors.
kw: Mobile Game, Motion Sensing Interaction, Android Processing

title: objectCollage
blurb: A quick and light mobile collage application for fashion concepts and other things...

title: hanuelBit

title: bHaptics

title: aerosweep

title: SOAP

title: coure
